KnownLibraries.Name: SPIFFS
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 SPIFFS File System

KnownLibraries.Name: ArduinoOTA
KnownLibraries.Author: Ivan Grokhotkov and Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables Over The Air upgrades, via wifi and espota.py UDP request/TCP download.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: With this library you can enable your sketch to be upgraded over network. Includes mdns anounces to get discovered by the arduino IDE.

KnownLibraries.Name: HTTPUpdate
KnownLibraries.Author: Markus Sattler
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Http Update for ESP32

KnownLibraries.Name: SPI
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables the communication with devices that use the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) Bus. For all Arduino boards, BUT Arduino DUE.

KnownLibraries.Name: ESP32
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 sketches examples

KnownLibraries.Name: HTTPUpdateServer
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Kapanakov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Simple HTTP Update server based on the WebServer
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: The library accepts HTTP post requests to the /update url, and updates the ESP32 firmware.

KnownLibraries.Name: WiFiProv
KnownLibraries.Author: Switi Mhaiske <sweetymhaiske@gmail.com>
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables provisioning.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: With this library you can perform provisioning on esp32 via SoftAP or BLE.

KnownLibraries.Name: BLE
KnownLibraries.Author: Neil Kolban <kolban1@kolban.com>
KnownLibraries.Sentence: BLE functions for ESP32
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: This library provides an implementation Bluetooth Low Energy support for the ESP32 using the Arduino platform.

KnownLibraries.Name: ESPmDNS
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 mDNS Library

KnownLibraries.Name: HTTPClient
KnownLibraries.Author: Markus Sattler
KnownLibraries.Sentence: HTTP Client for ESP32

KnownLibraries.Name: WiFi
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables network connection (local and Internet) using the ESP32 built-in WiFi.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: With this library you can instantiate Servers, Clients and send/receive UDP packets through WiFi. The shield can connect either to open or encrypted networks (WEP, WPA). The IP address can be assigned statically or through a DHCP. The library can also manage DNS.

KnownLibraries.Name: NetBIOS
KnownLibraries.Author: Pablo@xpablo.cz
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables NBNS (NetBIOS) name resolution.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: With this library you can connect to your ESP from Windows using a short name

KnownLibraries.Name: WiFiClientSecure
KnownLibraries.Author: Evandro Luis Copercini
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables secure network connection (local and Internet) using the ESP32 built-in WiFi.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: With this library you can make a TLS or SSL connection to a remote server.

KnownLibraries.Name: EEPROM
KnownLibraries.Author: Ivan Grokhotkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables reading and writing data a sequential, addressable FLASH storage

KnownLibraries.Name: Wire
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Allows the communication between devices or sensors connected via Two Wire Interface Bus. For esp8266 boards.

KnownLibraries.Name: BluetoothSerial
KnownLibraries.Author: Evandro Copercini
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Simple UART to Classical Bluetooth bridge for ESP32

KnownLibraries.Name: SD
KnownLibraries.Author: Arduino, SparkFun
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Enables reading and writing on SD cards. For all Arduino boards.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: Once an SD memory card is connected to the SPI interfare of the Arduino board you are enabled to create files and read/write on them. You can also move through directories on the SD card.

KnownLibraries.Name: Ticker
KnownLibraries.Author: Bert Melis
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Allows to call functions with a given interval.

KnownLibraries.Name: FFat
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov, Larry Bernstone
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 FAT on Flash File System

KnownLibraries.Name: Update
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 Sketch Update Library

KnownLibraries.Name: WebServer
KnownLibraries.Author: Ivan Grokhotkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Simple web server library
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: The library supports HTTP GET and POST requests, provides argument parsing, handles one client at a time.

KnownLibraries.Name: DNSServer
KnownLibraries.Author: Kristijan Novoselić
KnownLibraries.Sentence: A simple DNS server for ESP32.
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: This library implements a simple DNS server.

KnownLibraries.Name: SimpleBLE
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Provides really simple BLE advertizer with just on and off

KnownLibraries.Name: SD_MMC
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 SDMMC File System

KnownLibraries.Name: AzureIoT
KnownLibraries.Author: Microsoft
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Azure IoT library for ESP32
KnownLibraries.Paragraph: This library provides an implementation of Azure IoT library.

KnownLibraries.Name: FS
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov, Ivan Grokhtkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: ESP32 File System

KnownLibraries.Name: Preferences
KnownLibraries.Author: Hristo Gochkov
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Provides friendly access to ESP32's Non-Volatile Storage

KnownLibraries.Name: AsyncUDP
KnownLibraries.Author: Me-No-Dev
KnownLibraries.Sentence: Async UDP Library for ESP32

BuildProperties.Value: -nostdlib "-L{compiler.sdk.path}/lib" "-L{compiler.sdk.path}/ld" -T esp32_out.ld -T esp32.project.ld -T esp32.rom.ld -T esp32.peripherals.ld -T esp32.rom.libgcc.ld -T esp32.rom.spiram_incompatible_fns.ld -u esp_app_desc -u ld_include_panic_highint_hdl -u call_user_start_cpu0 -Wl,--gc-sections -Wl,-static -Wl,--undefined=uxTopUsedPriority  -u __cxa_guard_dummy -u __cxx_fatal_exception

python "{path}/{cmd}" --chip esp32 --port "{serial.port}" --baud {upload.speed}  --before default_reset --after hard_reset write_flash -z --flash_mode {build.flash_mode} --flash_freq {build.flash_freq} --flash_size detect 0xe000 "{runtime.platform.path}/tools/partitions/boot_app0.bin" 0x1000 "{runtime.platform.path}/tools/sdk/bin/bootloader_{build.boot}_{build.flash_freq}.bin" 0x10000 "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin" 0x8000 "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.partitions.bin"
